      • MessageManager

        Instantiates messageManager

    • Method Detail

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(java.lang.String from,
                        java.lang.String content,
                        java.lang.String... to)
        User sends a message to one or more users. This message is stored in inboxes.
        Parameters:
        from - Username of the sender of this message
        content - Content of the message
        to - Usernames of one or a list of recipients to this message

      • retrieveUserInbox

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.List<Message>> retrieveUserInbox(java.lang.String user)
        Returns the inbox of the given user.
        Parameters:
        user - Username of the user whose inbox will be retrieved.
        Returns:
        A hashmap that maps the username of sender to a list of Message sent to the given user.

      • retrieveUserInboxFor

        public java.util.List<Message> retrieveUserInboxFor(java.lang.String user,
                                                    java.lang.String from)
        Returns the messages sent from one user to another user.
        Parameters:
        user - Username of the recipient.
        from - Username of the sender.
        Returns:
        A list of Message.

      • singleInboxToString

        public java.lang.String singleInboxToString(java.lang.String username,
                                            java.lang.String from)
        Returns the String representation of all the messages sent from one user to another user. If the given sender bas never sent to this user before, returns "You have no messages from this username.".
        Parameters:
        username - Username of the recipient.
        from - Username of the sender.
        Returns:
        A string of message content sent from one user to another user, or "You have no messages from this username." if this user's inbox doesn't contain the sender's username as a key.

      • wholeInboxToString

        public java.lang.String wholeInboxToString(java.lang.String username)
        Returns the string representation of all the message sent to the user. If no one has sent to the given user before , returns "You have no messages".
        Parameters:
        username - Username of the user whose inbox will be retrieved.
        Returns:
        A string of all the message content sent to the user sort by the username of the sender, or "You have no messages" if this user's inbox is empty.

      • getInboxAsArray

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String[]> getInboxAsArray(java.lang.String user)
        Returns a list of the information of all message sent to the user including sender, sent time, content, and all recipients.
        Parameters:
        user - Username of the recipient.
        Returns:
        A list of String[] that stores all information of all the messages sent to the given user. Each String[] contains the sender's username at index 0, sent time at index 1, content at index 2, and String[] of recipients' usernames at index 3, of a single message sent to the given user.

      • putMessageFromArray

        public void putMessageFromArray(java.lang.String user,
                                java.lang.String[] row)
        Create a new Message sent to the given user from a row storing all information about that Message. Put the message into the user inbox.
        Parameters:
        user - Username of the recipient.
        row - A String[] with sender's username at index 0, sent time at index 1, message content at index 2, and String[] of recipients' usernames at index 3.

      • getAllUsersWithInboxes

        public java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String> getAllUsersWithInboxes()
        Returns an iterator over all users of the inbox.
        Returns:
        An iterator that iterates through the keys, which represent the username of the recipients, in a hashmap, which is the inboxes.
